Class ClientSession

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.global.ClientSession
public class ClientSession extends Object

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addRequestToQueue(UserRequest receivedRequest)
    adds the client's request to its individual queue the request will then be dispatched to global manager or to the game controller
    void
    assignUsername(String username)
    sets the username attribute equal to the username passed as a parameter
    void
    attachGame(GameController game)
    saves a reference to the game the player joined inside client session, allowing the client's request to bypass global request and be passed straight to the game
    void
    commonConstructor(GlobalManager globalManager, ClientHandler clientHandler, ConnectionType c)
     
    void
    detachGame()
    removes reference to the game the player was in
    RMIRemoteServer
    exportRMIServerStub()
    for exporting the RMI server stub
    String
    getClientSessionID()
    getClientSessionID() returns the clientSessionID, that has been generated when the client when they first joined the lobby
    ClientSessionState
    getClientSessionState()
    getState() returns the state of the session.
    ConnectionType
    getConnectionType()
    checks what connection type the player implements
    String
    getUsername()
    getUsername() returns the username if the user's already authenticated, throws an exception otherwise
    void
    log(String log)
    takes a log and encapsulates it in a ServerResponse object, and passes it to methods that take care of+ sending it to the player
    void
    notify(ServerResponse responseToSend)
    sends to send a generic server response to the player.
    void
    onDisconnect()
    executes the disconnection routine: the client session is removed from those in global manager, and in case the player was in a game, from the game as well.
    void
    onLogin(String username)
    executes a routine in case of effective login.
    void
    onLogout()
    executes a full logout routine
    void
    removeUsername()
    removes the username assigned to the player
    void
    sendResponse(ServerResponse response)
    to actually send the response to the player, by interacting with the client handler the client handler can either be RMI or SOCKET.
    void
    setAsAuthenticated()
    sets the client as authenticated
    void
    setAsInGame()
    changeStateToGame() is used by the lobby to change the status of its users when the game starts
    void
    setAsPreAuthenticated()
    initializes the client session as pre-authenticated, which signifies that the client connected to the server and has initialized a session, but hasn't yet logged in using its credentials
    void
    startDispatchingRequests()
    starts a separate thread that picks the first player request in the queue and dispatches it
    void
    startSendingResponses()
    starts a separate thread for sending responses to the client.

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientSession

      public ClientSession(GlobalManager globalManager, Socket clientSocket)

    • ClientSession

      public ClientSession(GlobalManager globalManager, RMIRemoteClient clientStubDelegate)

  • Method Details

    • commonConstructor

      public void commonConstructor(GlobalManager globalManager, ClientHandler clientHandler, ConnectionType c)

    • exportRMIServerStub

      public RMIRemoteServer exportRMIServerStub()
      for exporting the RMI server stub
      Returns:
      the RMI remote server stub

    • addRequestToQueue

      public void addRequestToQueue(UserRequest receivedRequest)
      adds the client's request to its individual queue the request will then be dispatched to global manager or to the game controller
      Parameters:
      receivedRequest - is the player request received by the player

    • startDispatchingRequests

      public void startDispatchingRequests()
      starts a separate thread that picks the first player request in the queue and dispatches it

    • notify

      public void notify(ServerResponse responseToSend)
      sends to send a generic server response to the player. the response will vary depending on what the server needs to communicate to the client. it may contain logs, and/or game deltas. however, the server response is independent of its content
      Parameters:
      responseToSend -

    • startSendingResponses

      public void startSendingResponses()
      starts a separate thread for sending responses to the client. it will pick responses in queue and send them through the network. this is done to avoid having the game threads or global threads interact with the network

    • getClientSessionState

      public ClientSessionState getClientSessionState()
      getState() returns the state of the session. The user can be authenticated, in game or still to authenticate
      Returns:
      the current state of the client session

    • getClientSessionID

      public String getClientSessionID()
      getClientSessionID() returns the clientSessionID, that has been generated when the client when they first joined the lobby

    • getUsername

      public String getUsername()
      getUsername() returns the username if the user's already authenticated, throws an exception otherwise

    • getConnectionType

      public ConnectionType getConnectionType()
      checks what connection type the player implements
      Returns:
      the connection type (either RMI or SOCKET)

    • sendResponse

      public void sendResponse(ServerResponse response)
      to actually send the response to the player, by interacting with the client handler the client handler can either be RMI or SOCKET. this is irrelevant to the sendResponse() method
      Parameters:
      response -

    • log

      public void log(String log)
      takes a log and encapsulates it in a ServerResponse object, and passes it to methods that take care of+ sending it to the player
      Parameters:
      log -

    • onLogin

      public void onLogin(String username)
      executes a routine in case of effective login. that means setting the client session as authenticated, and storing the player's name directly inside it so as to make the username accessible to any part of the server that has access to client session
      Parameters:
      username - is the username of the player that logged in with that username (and its respective password)

    • assignUsername

      public void assignUsername(String username)
      sets the username attribute equal to the username passed as a parameter
      Parameters:
      username - is the username to assign to the client session

    • setAsAuthenticated

      public void setAsAuthenticated()
      sets the client as authenticated

    • attachGame

      public void attachGame(GameController game)
      saves a reference to the game the player joined inside client session, allowing the client's request to bypass global request and be passed straight to the game
      Parameters:
      game -

    • detachGame

      public void detachGame()
      removes reference to the game the player was in

    • setAsInGame

      public void setAsInGame()
      changeStateToGame() is used by the lobby to change the status of its users when the game starts

    • onLogout

      public void onLogout() throws LogoutWhileInGameException, ClientNotYetAuthenticatedException
      executes a full logout routine
      Throws:
      LogoutWhileInGameException - in case the player attempts to log out while in game
      ClientNotYetAuthenticatedException - in case attempts to log out having logged in

    • onDisconnect

      public void onDisconnect()
      executes the disconnection routine: the client session is removed from those in global manager, and in case the player was in a game, from the game as well. also, the sender and received thread are interrupted

    • removeUsername

      public void removeUsername()
      removes the username assigned to the player

    • setAsPreAuthenticated

      public void setAsPreAuthenticated()
      initializes the client session as pre-authenticated, which signifies that the client connected to the server and has initialized a session, but hasn't yet logged in using its credentials
